Pre-Game Insights: The Egyptian national football team, under the leadership of Hossam Hassan, is set to face Botswana in a pivotal second-round match of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) qualifiers.
Hossam Hassan has worked closely with his players to prepare for this encounter, urging them to focus on scoring an early goal and maintaining balance between attack and defense.
Hassan’s tactical plan will focus on quick transitions and utilizing the speed of Egypt’s star players, particularly on the wings.

Injuries have forced Hassan to make adjustments to his lineup. Key players like Imam Ashour, Omar Marmoush, and Mostafa Mohamed are unavailable due to injury, and experienced defender Ahmed Hegazy will miss the match due to personal reasons.
Despite these setbacks, Hassan has opted to retain Hamdi Fathi and Rami Rabia in central defense, while relying on Mohamed Elneny, Marawan Attia, and Zizo to control the midfield.
The attack will feature a formidable trio of Mohamed Salah, Trezeguet, and Osama Faisal.
Salah, Egypt’s captain and key player, will lead the offensive charge, with his pace and finishing ability expected to be crucial in breaking down Botswana’s defense.
Trezeguet’s creativity and Osama Faisal’s presence as a central striker will complement Salah’s efforts, providing Egypt with a balanced and potent attack.
The starting lineup is expected to feature Mohamed El-Shennawy in goal, with Mohamed Hani, Hamdi Fathi, Rami Rabia, and Mohamed Hamdi forming the defensive line.
The midfield trio of Attia, Elneny, and Zizo will provide both defensive cover and attacking support, while Salah, Trezeguet, and Faisal will be tasked with leading the attack.
